page.title: 07RELIGION YARMOUTH CHURCH
page.content: The church in Yarmouth is not the first church. The first church was built in 1117.The French destroyed the church in 1377 and again 200 yrs later This church was built in 1614 and is built of stone. St James is the patron Saint of Yarmouth Church. The tower was raised in 1831 by Daniel Alexander I have been up in the tower.The font is inside of the north door.In the church there is a statue of Sir Robert Holmes behind the choirstalls.There is an organ upstairs and a piano downstairs.There are seats for 232 people.The roads are named after people who lived here and in the church there are memorials to them.A famous clockman, Nicholas Paris made the clock. Every Tuesday Yarmouth school goes to the church for worship. The priest is called Father Ken.
